beae-6363fbe1eab2fd382f4b8be2.ENJOYTHESWEETWORLDOFLIBERTYORCHARDS45_ht:
ENJOY THE SWEET WORLD
OF LIBERTY ORCHARDS
beae-6363fbe1eab2fd382f4b8be2.MakerofApletsampCotletsOriginalFruitAndN:
Maker of Aplets & Cotlets
Original Fruit-And-Nut Candies
beae-6363fbe1eab2fd382f4b8be2.I3beoPCPABPSRCASMPaCO315_html: Includes 3 bars each of Pineapple & Coconut, Pear Almond, Blueberry & Pomegranate, Strawberry & Raspberry, Cherry Almond, SPICY Mango & Papaya, and Cranberry Orange.
beae-6363fbe1eab2fd382f4b8be2.OcwfbteAiwsitltoClithotWSocI1tcAmwaawgil: Our company was founded by two enterprising Armenian immigrants who settled in the little town of Cashmere, located in the heart of the Washington State orchard country. In 1920 they created Aplets, made with apples and walnuts grown in local orchards. That original idea has expanded to the full line of fruit-and-nut candies and fine food gifts that you'll find at LibertyOrchards.com.

beae-about-us.OsswtiadaisuoaclAian151_html:
Our story started with two immigrants and
a dream... and is still unfolding over a century later. 
It’s America in a nutshell.
beae-about-us.Atbot2cofMBaATaiAamtwttoCitocoWSTtpaafan: At the beginning of the 20th century, our founders Mark Balaban and Armen Tertsagian arrived in America and made their way to the "Vale of Cashmere," in the orchard country of Washington State. There they purchased an apple farm and named it "Liberty Orchards" in honor of their new homeland. Soon they were producing more apples than they could sell, and had the idea to recreate "locoum," a favorite old-world confection, using their surplus fruit mixed with fresh walnuts. They named their new candy Aplets®, and a few years later they added Cotlets®, made with apricots and walnuts. Since then, Liberty Orchards has created a delicious variety of fruit confections, but we still make them much like Mark and Armen did back in 1920. We still use only the finest quality ingredients, slow-cooked to sweet perfection in small batches. We still pack each tempting morsel by hand. And, most important of all, we still have a dedication to impeccable quality that you can taste in every bite!
beae-about-us.WHATMAKESOURCANDIESTASTESOGOOD40_html:
WHAT MAKES OUR CANDIES
TASTE SO GOOD?
beae-about-us.Madewithpremiumfruitsandnuts_html: Made with premium fruits and nuts
beae-about-us.TiuiocawatWunfpajcftrmfffogiebTfotoabwap: The ingredients used in our candies are wholesome and traditional. We use natural fruit purées and juices, created from the ripest, most flavorful fruits for orchard-grown goodness in every bite. These fruits of the orchard are blended with apple pectin, pure sugar, and other natural, preservative-free ingredients, then slow-simmered in special candymaking kettles. We make our candy in small batches, and test the recipe every few minutes as the candy cooks. When the consistency is just right, we add fresh crunchy nuts, hand-sorted for exceptional quality.
beae-about-us.Adedicationtoqualityfromthebeginning_htm: A dedication to quality from the beginning
beae-about-us.Bi1wwsmodhciwsutttttdtrSwofsewwtutftgaLO: Back in 1920 when we started making our delicious homestyle candies, it wasn't so unusual to take the time to do things right. So when our founders started experimenting with ways to use the fruit they grew at Liberty Orchards in their old country candy recipe, they naturally did things the homestyle way. What is unusual, is that now, over 100 years later, we still make our candies by the same time honored methods, using the same secret family recipe.
beae-about-us.TheuniquelydelicioustasteofLibertyOrchar:
The uniquely delicious
taste of Liberty Orchards
beae-about-us.Fwaopitdskwtacisbacmuohsactia_html: First we add our premium ingredients to double-jacketed steam kettles where they are cooked in small batches and carefully monitored until our hallmark so and chewy texture is achieved.
beae-about-us.TmcipiwptFtittactsAbcesistagcwieuibp_htm: The molten candy is poured into wooden plastic-lined trays. From there it’s taken to a cooler to set. After being chilled, each slab is sent through a guillotine cutter where it ends up in bite-sized pieces.
beae-about-us.Eachtastymorselpackedbyhandnbsp_html: Each tasty morsel packed by hand!
beae-about-us.AttccipstpasdapltncpEpicfpstpipt_html: After tumbling the cut candy in powdered sugar, the pieces are sent down a packing line to nimble-fingered candy packers. Each piece is checked for proper sizing then packed into plastic trays.
beae-about-us.Aptctrteotlwtapibcwapdwictdtaibblic_html: After packing, the candy trays reach the end of the line where they are placed in boxes, coded with a pack date, wrapped in cellophane, then delivered to an inspector before being loaded into cases.
beae-about-us.vwgyabgihwmofc292_html: The video will give you a behind-the-scenes glimpse into how we make our famous candies
beae-about-us.WwvtoRSaTCidCW93_html:
We welcome visitors to our Retail Store and Tour Center
in downtown Cashmere, Washington!
beae-about-us.Pleasecheckbackbeforeyourvisittoconfirmh: Please check back before your visit to confirm hours
beae-about-us.HyctttotCLashocamfhnthbAdftsFcffofYafawa: Here you can take the "sweetest tour on the Cascade Loop" and see how our candies are made from hand-sorted nuts to hand-packed boxes. And don't forget to sample FREE candies fresh from our factory! You'll also find a wide assortment of gifts and delicacies from the Pacific Northwest in addition to the many varieties of America's Favorite Fruit-And-Nut Candy! See below for hours of operation.
